intro: Meriania leucantha var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf meriania, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, often found in moist, shaded environments within the understory of tropical forests. Its flowers are borne in clusters and are pollinated by insects, contributing to its ecological role in the rainforest ecosystem. The varietal form angustifolia is distinguished by its narrower leaves compared to the typical form of the species.
